Beginner.Title: Welcome to Modumate!
Beginner.Description: It looks like it's your first time here! Let's go over the basic actions of using Modumate. This should take 4-5 minutes.

Beginner.Title: Full-Screen
Beginner.Description: Press F11 to enter/exit fullscreen mode (optional, but recommended!).

Beginner.Title: Orbit
Beginner.Description: Right-click-drag in the scene to orbit around the point you hit. It will pull gently toward the center of the screen.

Beginner.Title: Pan
Beginner.Description: Middle-click-drag in the scene to pan the camera side to side.

Beginner.Title: Zoom
Beginner.Description: Scroll up to zoom in. Scroll down to zoom out.

Beginner.Title: Quick Views
Beginner.Description: Click the Quick Views to snap to an axis-aligned view (such as top-down), or use Ctrl + arrow keys to switch quick views.

Beginner.Title: Select Tool
Beginner.Description: The Select tool is your home base. Click objects to select them. From any other tool, press Escape or the hotkey "SE" to return to the Select tool.

Beginner.Title: Massing Graph View Mode
Beginner.Description: Press F1 to view your project's Massing Graph (which is a diagram of all the assemblies in your project that separate space).

Beginner.Title: Line Tool
Beginner.Description: Click the Massing Graph Tools, then the Line tool - or type the hotkey "LI".

Beginner.Title: Draw A Line
Beginner.Description: Close the loop near the project's origin. Snap to one vertex, click, then snap to the other and click. Draw more edges if you want, then press Escape to stop drawing.

Beginner.Title: Undo/Redo
Beginner.Description: Press Ctrl+Z to undo your last action, and Ctrl+Y to redo your last undone action.

Beginner.Title: Type A Distance
Beginner.Description: Start a line, Mouse along a linear snap, type 10'-0", and press Enter.

Beginner.Title: Force A Linear Snap
Beginner.Description: Mouse along the Blue linear snap, hold Shift, snap to the top of the nearby rectangle, and click.

Beginner.Title: Rectangle Tool
Beginner.Description: Click the Massing Graph Tools, then the Rectangle tool - or type the hotkey "RE".

Beginner.Title: Draw A 3-Click Rectangle
Beginner.Description: Click a start point, mouse in a direction, type 8'-0" and press Enter, then mouse in a direction, type 15'-2 1/2" and press Enter.

Beginner.Title: Extrude A Rectangle
Beginner.Description: Click a vertical line, mouse in a direction, type 20'-0" and press Enter. Keep extruding rectangles, or press Escape to end the chain.

Beginner.Title: Stretch Handles
Beginner.Description: Select a plane, click a Stretch Handle, type 4'-0" and press Enter.

Beginner.Title: DimStrings
Beginner.Description: Select a plane, line, or vertex, click a dark DimString, type a new length, and press Enter.

Beginner.Title: Separator View Mode
Beginner.Description: Press F2 to view your project's Separators (the BIM construction assemblies that separate spaces, like walls, floors, doors, windows, etc).

Beginner.Title: Wall Tool
Beginner.Description: Click the Separator Tools, then the Wall tool (or type hotkey "WA").

Beginner.Title: Host A Wall
Beginner.Description: Choose the Exterior Wood Stud Wall from the starter assemblies, then hover a plane in the scene, and click.

Beginner.Title: Hosting Properties
Beginner.Description: Begin to host another wall. Before clicking, press F to flip the wall over its plane, and W/A/S/D to move the wall up/left/down/right between three hosting positions: Back, Centerline, or Front.

Beginner.Title: Host a Window
Beginner.Description: Click the Window tool (or type hotkey "WN"), choose the Fixed Window from the starter assemblies, then hover a plane in the scene, and click.

Beginner.Title: Switch to Surface Graph view mode
Beginner.Description: Press F3 to view your project's Surface Graphs (where you lay out regions for Attachments, like finishes and cabinets).

Beginner.Title: Add a Surface Graph
Beginner.Description: Click the Surface Graph Tools (or type the hotkey "SG")., then click a surface of a Separator that does not yet have a Surface Graph.

Beginner.Title: Subdivide Surface Graph
Beginner.Description: Draw a line across your new Surface Graph.

Beginner.Title: Switch to Attachments view mode
Beginner.Description: Press F4 to view your project's Attachments (the BIM construction assemblies that decorate surfaces, like finishes, trim, cabinets, and FF&E).

Beginner.Title: Add a Sofa
Beginner.Description: Click the Attachments Tools, then the FF&E tool (or type hotkey "FF"). Search "sofa" in the assemblies list. Click a sofa. Click in the scene.

Beginner.Title: Add a Finish
Beginner.Description: Click the Finish tool (or type hotkey "FI"). Pick the "Exterior Brick Veneer", then click on a Surface Graph face.

Beginner.Title: Modify Tile Color
Beginner.Description: Click the "edit" button on the Exterior Brick Veneer. Click the Thin Bricks layer. Click the Thin Brick Veneer. Change its color to be light tan. Click "Save". Click "Back to Project".

Beginner.Title: Add a Cut Plane
Beginner.Description: Click the Cut Planes menu, then Add A Cut Plane (or type hotkey "CP"). Click a point in scene the plane will pass through. Click the direction the cut plane should look. Press Escape.

Beginner.Title: Export DWGs
Beginner.Description: Click the Cut Planes menu, then "Export All Cut Planes". Choose a save location on your PC. Open the DWGs in a CAD platform like AutoCAD.

Beginner.Title: You've got the basics!
Beginner.Description:
Congratulations, you did great! You've learned the basic tools of Modumate, and could probably start your own project now.

However, there's still plenty more to learn, like Move, Rotate, Join, Fly, Walk, and more! We suggest moving on to the Intermediate Tutorial if you have the time. 

[go to main menu] [go to intermediate tutorial]

Intermediate.Title: Intro
Intermediate.Description: Welcome to the Intermediate tutorial! Following the Beginner tutorial, let's add more simple-but-useful commands, and some more complex topics too. This should take 10-12 minutes.

Intermediate.Title: Add to Selection
Intermediate.Description: In Select Mode, hold Shift to add objects to selection.

Intermediate.Title: Remove from Selection
Intermediate.Description: In Select tool, hold Ctrl to remove objects from selection.

Intermediate.Title: Bounding Select
Intermediate.Description: In Select tool, click-drag to the left to select bounded objects.

Intermediate.Title: Crossing Select
Intermediate.Description: In Select tool, click-drag to the right to select crossed objects.

Intermediate.Title: Hide
Intermediate.Description: Select an object and click Hide (or type "HI").

Intermediate.Title: Unhide
Intermediate.Description: Click Unhide (or type "UH").

Intermediate.Title: Hide Upper Levels
Intermediate.Description: Tip: hiding upper levels is a good way to design interiors. Bounding-Select (from left to right) the roof, then Hide it (HI).

Intermediate.Title: Recap: The 4 Layer Hierarchy
Intermediate.Description:
Modumate models are a 4 layer hierarchy. Each layer hosts onto the previous layer.
Press F1 to view the Massing Graph (a planar model of the project's spaces, space-separating assemblies, and how those assemblies connect).
Press F2 to view Separators (assemblies that separate space, such as Walls, Floors, Roofs, Doors, Railings, etc).
Press F3 to view Surface Graphs (planar diagrams for where Attachments go).
Press F4 to view Attachments (assemblies that decorate surfaces, including Finishes, Trim, Cabinets, and FF&E).

Intermediate.Title: Camera Tips
Intermediate.Description: The next 4 steps teach you new camera tricks.

Intermediate.Title: Field of View
Intermediate.Description: Move your camera into the project. Open the 3D Views menu. Type 90 into the FOV field. We suggest ~50 for exterior modeling, and 90-100 for interior modeling.

Intermediate.Title: Fly
Intermediate.Description: Hold right-click, then press Q/W/E/A/S/D - W to fly forward, S to fly back, A to fly left, D to fly right, E to fly up, and Q to fly down.

Intermediate.Title: Fly Through Blocking Walls
Intermediate.Description: Tip: while designing interiors, if you ever zoom out and get stuck behind a wall, just Fly forward (right-click-hold + W) to fly through it.

Intermediate.Title: Walk
Intermediate.Description: Put your camera over the foyer. Open the 3D Views menu. Toggle Gravity to "On". Hold right-click and move the mouse to look around. Press W/A/S/D to walk. Toggle Gravity to "Off" to stop walking.

Intermediate.Title: Modeling Tips
Intermediate.Description: The next 6 steps teach you new Massing Graph modeling tricks.

Intermediate.Title: Move
Intermediate.Description: With objects selected, click the Move tool, click a start point for a move vector, mouse to an end point (or snap to linear axes, and/or type a distance), and click to complete the move.

Intermediate.Title: Move Massing Regions
Intermediate.Description: Tip: easily change your massing by selecting many objects and Moving them.

Intermediate.Title: Planes Must Stay Planar
Intermediate.Description: Tip: you can only move objects if your Massing Planes will stay planar. Notice this vertex can only move along the line shared by both its planes.

Intermediate.Title: Rotate
Intermediate.Description: With objects selected, click the Rotate tool. Click a center of rotation. Click a reference angle. Mouse to a target angle (or snap to 90's, or type an angle). Click to complete the rotation.

Intermediate.Title: Join Planes
Intermediate.Description: Click the Join tool (or type hotkey "JO"). Click the plane to keep. Click the coplanar plane to absorb. Press escape.

Intermediate.Title: Join Edges
Intermediate.Description: Click the Join tool (or type hotkey "JO"). Click the edge to keep. Click the colinear edge to absorb. Press escape.

Intermediate.Title: Delete
Intermediate.Description: Select an object and press Delete.

Intermediate.Title: Minimal Delete
Intermediate.Description: Select a plane or edge and press Ctrl + Delete. The selected object should be deleted, but as much other content as possible should remain.

Intermediate.Title: Roof Tools
Intermediate.Description: The next 4 steps teach you about our Roof tool.

Intermediate.Title: Create A Roof Perimeter
Intermediate.Description: Select a planar loop of edges (or a plane) and type the hotkey "RP". The edges are added to a Roof Perimeter, and turn dark blue.

Intermediate.Title: Modify Edge Properties
Intermediate.Description: Click the edit icon on a Roof Perimeter edge. Choose its properties, like a slope and whether that edge is gabled or hipped. Click "Commit".

Intermediate.Title: Publish Roof
Intermediate.Description: When you're happy with all your edges' properties, click the "+" button at the center of the Roof Perimeter. Massing Planes will be created.

Intermediate.Title: Unpublish Roof
Intermediate.Description: If you don't like your Roof, you can click any dark blue edge and click the X button at its center to unpublish the Roof and continue editing its edges.

Intermediate.Title: Create Eaves
Intermediate.Description: Eaves can be modeled line by line, by setting out the meaningful points. Connect these meaningful points to complete the roof's eaves.

Intermediate.Title: "Presets" - The Basic Unit Of BIM
Intermediate.Description: The next 12 steps teach you about Presets and how to craft your own.

Intermediate.Title: What's A Preset?
Intermediate.Description: A "Preset" is the basic unit of our BIM. Every construction object, from Separators and Attachments right down to the layers and parts they're made of, is a Preset.

Intermediate.Title: Enter BIM Designer
Intermediate.Description: Click the Wall tool (or press "WA"). Click "Edit" next to the Typical Exterior Wall. This opens the BIM Designer.

Intermediate.Title: Pan
Intermediate.Description: Just like the 3D scene, middle-click and drag to pan the BIM Designer.

Intermediate.Title: Zoom
Intermediate.Description: Just like the 3D scene, scroll up to zoom into the BIM Designer, and scroll down to zoom out.

Intermediate.Title: Tree of Nodes ("Parent" and "Child")
Intermediate.Description: The BIM Designer shows the parts of a Preset as a tree of nodes. We call these relationships "parent" and "child". A Layer is a "child" of a Wall. A Stud is a "child" of a Layer.

Intermediate.Title: Swap Preset
Intermediate.Description: Click "Swap" on its OSB layer. Type "Plywood" into the swap search bar. Click the 15/32" Plywood layer's checkmark.

Intermediate.Title: "Blue" Nodes Have Unsaved Changes
Intermediate.Description: The parent Wall preset has unsaved changes. It wants to know: by swapping my child, did you mean to update me, or branch off me to make a new Wall?

Intermediate.Title: Edit Name
Intermediate.Description: Type "Typical Exterior Wall" into the Wall's Name field and press Enter.

Intermediate.Title: Save Preset
Intermediate.Description: Click "Save Preset" to save your changes. This will update all instances in scene.

Intermediate.Title: Reorder Layers
Intermediate.Description: Click and drag on the layer's grab handle. Drag upward until your cursor is above the waterproofing layer. Release your click.

Intermediate.Title: Cancel Unsaved Changes
Intermediate.Description: Click "Cancel" on the unsaved parent node to revert its tree to how it used to be.

Intermediate.Title: Edit Dimension
Intermediate.Description: Click the Wateproofing layer. Type 1/4" into its Thickness. Rename the preset "Typical Waterproofing" and Save As New Preset. Save the Wall preset.

Intermediate.Title: Edit Color
Intermediate.Description: Click "Swap" on the Waterproofing layer's Color. Pick a subtle blue color. Click outside the color picker. Save the preset.

Intermediate.Title: Swap Pattern
Intermediate.Description: Click on the Stud layer. Click "Swap" on its child Pattern. Click the checkmark next to "19.2in O.C.". Rename the parent layer "Typical Exterior Studs". Save the parent layer as a new preset. Save the Wall preset.

Intermediate.Title: Swap Material
Intermediate.Description: Click on the Stud layer's child Stud. Click "Swap" next to its Material. Scroll down and click the checkmark next to Pine. Rename the stud "Typical Exterior Stud" and save it as a new preset.

Intermediate.Title: Swap Selected Object's Preset
Intermediate.Description: Press F2. Select a Separator, like a Wall. Click its assembly's Swap icon. Choose a new assembly and click its checkmark.

Intermediate.Title: Hosting (Offset and Flip)
Intermediate.Description: The next 2 steps teach you all the ways you can offset and flip your Separators.

Intermediate.Title: Offset Up / Down / Left / Right
Intermediate.Description: Select the patio's post. Turn your camera so that it looks downward along the post. Press W to move the post one stop "up". Press S to move it down. Press A to move it left. Press D to move it right.

Intermediate.Title: Flip Across / Along / Vertical
Intermediate.Description: Select a brick wall. Press F to flip it across its host. Press R to reverse it along its host. Press V to flip it vertically.

Intermediate.Title: Surface Graph Fragility
Intermediate.Description: The next 3 steps teach you that Surface Graphs are fragile.

Intermediate.Title: Surface Graph Fragility (pt.1)
Intermediate.Description:
Press F4. Observe the finishes on this wall. Press F3. Observe the Surface Graphs they're hosted to. Press F1. Draw a Massing edge that splits this wall's plane. Press F4. notice the finishes and Surface Graphs are gone! Press Ctrl + Z to undo.

Make sure your Massing Graph and Separators are complete before investing time in detailed Surface Graphs.

Intermediate.Title: Surface Graph Fragility (pt.2)
Intermediate.Description:
Press F1. Draw a Massing edge along this wall's base. Press F3. Notice the Surface Graphs are gone! 

Make sure your Massing Graph and Separators are complete before investing time in detailed Surface Graphs.

Intermediate.Title: Detach A Surface Graph
Intermediate.Description:
Press F3. Select a Surface Graph's bounding edge(s). Use the Move tool to move them off the host surface's boundary.

Your surface graph is now "detached", and can be resized if needed, such as to host a Cabinet that straddles two Surface Graphs.

Intermediate.Title: Create Cabinet
Intermediate.Description: Enter the Cabinet tool. Choose a Cabinet. Click a Surface Graph face. Extrude a Cabinet by typing a distance. Click the button to choose a front face.

Intermediate.Title: Flip / Offset Trim
Intermediate.Description: Select a Trim. Press W to offset it up, or A to offset it left, or S to offset it down, or D to offset it right. Press V to flip it across its host edge.

Intermediate.Title: FF&E Move Handles
Intermediate.Description: Select an FF&E. Click its corner handles. Move the mouse and click again, or type a distance and press Enter.

Intermediate.Title: FF&E Rotate Handle
Intermediate.Description: Select an FF&E. Click its Rotate handle. Move the mouse and click again, or type an angle and press Enter.

Intermediate.Title: Save A 3D View
Intermediate.Description: Open the 3D Views menu. Click the "+" next to 3D Views.

Intermediate.Title: Rename a 3D View
Intermediate.Description: Open the 3D Views Menu. Click a saved view's Edit button. Type a new name and press Enter.

Intermediate.Title: Hotkey Summary
Intermediate.Description:
Here's a handy summary of the hotkeys you've learned:

Camera: F11 to fullscreen. Right-click to Orbit. Middle-click to Pan. Scroll up/down to Zoom in/out. Ctrl + Arrows to snap to axis-aligned views. Right-click + QWEASD to fly or walk. F1 / F2 / F3 / F4 to cycle between view modes.

Create tools: 
Massing Graph - "LI" for Line. "RE" for Rectangle. "RP" for Roof Perimeter.
Separators - "WA" for Wall. "FL" for Floor. "CL" for Ceiling. "RF" for Roof. "ST" for Stair. "RA" for Railing. "DR" for Door. "WN" for Window. "SP" for System Panel. "MU" for Mullion. "BC" for Beam/Column. "CT" for Countertop. 
Surface Graph - "SG" for Surface Graph.
Attachments - "FI" for Finish. "TR" for Trim. "CA" for Cabinet. "FF" for FF&E.

Other tools:
"SE" for Select. "MV" for Move. "RO" for Rotate. "JO" for Join. "HI" for Hide. "UH" for Unhide. Ctrl + Delete for Minimal Delete. Ctrl + Z for Undo. Ctrl + Y for Redo. "CP" for Cut Plane.

Intermediate.Title: Congratulations!
Intermediate.Description: You've now seen pretty much all the commands Modumate has to offer. Feel free to start your own projects from the Main Menu.

VideoTutorials.Title: Modumate in 60 Seconds
VideoTutorials.Description: See Modumate's whole workflow in less than a minute.

VideoTutorials.Title: 7-Minute Tour
VideoTutorials.Description: See a deeper dive into Modumate's workflow in this seven-minute overview.

VideoTutorials.Title: 1A: Model Your Massing Graph
VideoTutorials.Description: The Massing Graph describes your building's separate spaces. Its elements become hosts for your construction assemblies and connection details. In this video, we show you how to create and edit your Massing Graph.

VideoTutorials.Title: 1B: Craft Your Separators
VideoTutorials.Description: "Separators" are the construction assemblies that separate spaces (Walls, Floors, Roofs, Ceilings, Doors, WIndows, Stairs, Railings, Panels, Countertops, Beams/Columns, and Mullions). In this video, we show you how to design them.

VideoTutorials.Title: 1C: Host Separators Onto Your Massing Graph
VideoTutorials.Description: Separators host onto your Massing Graph to give it physical form. In this video, we show you how to host them quickly and easily to make your building real.

VideoTutorials.Title: 2A: Model Your Surface Graphs
VideoTutorials.Description: Surface Graphs describe the layout of your finishes, cabinets, and trim. In this video, we show you how to create and edit your Surface Graphs.

VideoTutorials.Title: 2B: Craft Your Attachments
VideoTutorials.Description: "Attachments" are your finishes, cabinets, trim, and FF&E - the interior elements that make a building special. In this video, we show you how to design them

VideoTutorials.Title: 2C: Host Attachments Onto Your Surface Graph
VideoTutorials.Description: Attachments host onto Surface Graphs to give them physical form. In this video, we show you how to host them quickly and easily to make your spaces beautiful and "finished".

VideoTutorials.Title: 3A: Instant Renderings and Walkthroughs
VideoTutorials.Description: Modumate is natively gorgeous, so it doesn't need separate rendering tools. In this video, we show you how to set up views and walkthroughs of your BIM model.

VideoTutorials.Title: 3B: Instant Background DWGs
VideoTutorials.Description: Modumate can instantly export beautiful background DWGs. In this video, we show you how to create Cut Planes and export DWGs.
